meanings.definition: The absence or loss of the ability to perceive visual stimuli.
meanings.sent1: After the accident, he experienced anopia and could no longer see.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed her with anopia, explaining why she couldn't see clearly.
meanings.sent3: Despite wearing glasses, his anopia made him think the moon was a giant cookie.
meanings.sent4: Her anopia was like a thick fog that clouded her vision completely.
meanings.sent5: The anopia in his eyes painted the world in shades of gray, like an old movie.

meanings.definition: A condition in which a person is unable to see.
meanings.sent1: The anopia in his left eye made reading difficult for him.
meanings.sent2: She had anopia since birth, but she never let it hold her back.
meanings.sent3: His anopia led to a funny incident where he tried to pet a statue, mistaking it for a cat.
meanings.sent4: The anopia of ignorance blinded him to the beauty of the world around him.
meanings.sent5: In the darkness of the cave, his anopia was a heavy burden, like carrying a sack of rocks.
